page.title: 01About our Area
page.content: Moreton Say gets the first part of its name from the low lying marshy land known as Smythemoor-the'tun'(farmstead on the moor and the second part is a legacy of the lordship of the De Saye family,from the 12th to the 14th century.The Drumble got its name because it was a prominent place for swarms of bees.It is locally believed that Audley Brow was named after Lord Audley who fought a battle there. Robert Clive who was born at nearby Styche Hall,was christened and buried at Moreton Say Church. In the centre of the village are the Church,the Rectory,the school,the school house,the Clive Memorial Church House,six council houses,one farm,two bungalows,three cottages and one private house.All around are scattered farms and rolling countryside.There are 4 council houses at Moreton Wood.
